thread.title: There's A Surprise At The End Of The First Episode Of "A Series Of Unfortunate Events"
thread.title_full: There's A Surprise At The End Of The First Episode Of "A Series Of Unfortunate Events"

author: Krystie Lee Yandoli
title: There's A Surprise At The End Of The First Episode Of "A Series Of Unfortunate Events"
text:
View this image ›
Netflix ID: 10312808 2. The Baudelaire children, Klaus and Violet (played by Louis Hynes and Malina Weissman), are incredibly smart and resilient. View this image ›
Netflix ID: 10312863 3. And Neil Patrick Harris is a creepy yet satisfying Count Olaf. View this image ›
Netflix ID: 10312819 4. Not to mention, there’s Alfre Woodard as Aunt Josephine and Joan Cusack as Justice Strauss. Netflix
Netflix
 ID: 10313386 5. But at the very end of the first episode, we find out possibly the best news of all: Cobie Smulders and Will Arnett are ALSO in the eight-episode series. Mike Coppola / Getty Images
Robyn Beck / Getty Images
 ID: 10321474 6. Their characters don’t have names… View this image ›
Netflix ID: 10313255 7. …but we know they play a kick-ass couple trying to make it home to their kids. View this image ›
Netflix ID: 10313359 8. Oh, and that they’ve been captured! View this image ›
Netflix ID: 10321330 9. Where are they going?! What does it all mean?! View this image ›
Netflix ID: 10320173 10. When a trailer for A Series of Unfortunate Events dropped in November, some people noticed that Smulders and Arnett are included in a group photo that Aunt Josephine gives to the Baudelaire children as she explains her relationship to their parents. View this image ›
Netflix ID: 10313321 11. And we definitely know that Smulders and Arnett are parents in the series. View this image ›
Netflix ID: 10313344 12. But are they Klaus, Violet, and Sunny’s parents?! View this image ›
Netflix ID: 10321770 13. This is all too much! View this image ›
CBS / Via giphy.com ID: 10315905
 More News About Will Arnett
